name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Select

reviews.text: The room was very dark and despite reserving a non-smoking room we were in fact given a smoking room - not to ideal! The A/C was a bit of a puzzle to us - it's behind the floor length curtains so how to stay cool at night?? As we had a reservation it would have been nice for it to already be on for our arrival - it took the overall inadequate unit forever to cool the room down. However, the staff could not have been nicer and the local pizzeria (Santa Lucia) was a real find (from a previous recommendation - thankyou) delicious, friendly and reasonable prices.

reviews.text: As stated by others this is a great value for your money if you don't mind the walk. To get into the city takes about 15-20 minutes walking, but the train station is only about a 10-15 minute walk (with my large pack on my back). They also have a space for cars, however trying to actually arrive there by car was a bit difficult because of all the one way roads.
reviews.title: Great for the budget if you don't mind the walk
Good Value, Good Exercise!
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and the staff extremely helpful and kind. They have a good map to get you into the city and around, but I would suggest stopping at one of the tourist info desk and picking up the map that includes all the public restrooms (WC).

They have a breakfast which was decent but could have included fresh fruit. In addition when they ran out of something for the breakfast (even if there was still an hour to go) they did not replenish it. I thought this was a bit odd given that the same thing was served every morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here on two different occasions, each time I've visited Florence. Once with my 22 year old (at the time) daughter and this time with my wife, cousin and two friends. It's a great boutique-type hotel just far enough away from the bustle of tourists, but close enough to walk from the train station and to all of the sightseeing Florence has to offer. And there's a delightful neighborhood square just around the corner with small local restaurants, shops, and characters. We were upgraded to new rooms across the street from the main hotel building and they were fabulous. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their English was better than my Italian. The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the morning. And the rooms are priced very reasonably for what you get.
reviews.title: Best Western Hotel Select in Florence is a great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too far from any sights of note, although they'll try to tell you that you can make it to the Cathedral in ten mins on foot. It's twenty mins and I wouldn't advise walking it at night. There are no cafes or restaurants nearby, just residential streets and urban decay. We were given a ground floor room the 1st night, which was so noisy it was untrue. To be fair they did move us to a 1st floor room when we complained but it faced the garden and a barking hound frequently interrupted our rest. When the dog wasn't baying, we were very busy disposing of mosquitoes in our room. I counted ten on the ceiling one night, amid numerous squash stains where previous residents had occasion to battle the insects. The furniture is dated and cumbersome, cue banging your foot or knee off some outsized chair when attempting to navigate your way to the bathroom at night. Staff were so-so, one nice girl at the desk, one very unhelpful gentleman on another occasion. Breakfast was downstairs, zealously watched over by a female member of staff who checked the clock every time one asked for something. Heaven forbid you might overstay the 10.30am limit. Bearing this in mind, the apparent good value of this hotel (Florence is pricey) is a fallacy
reviews.title: Grim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having previously been to Florence further off season (Nov or Feb), our usual hotels were way pricier. We hence decided to stay a little further out. When we got there we were taken to the new rooms across the road from the main block. We were really surprised, there were large and modern, with a sofa, contemporary furniture and a large flat screen TV.

reviews.title: Good Hotel, Long Walk
reviews.text: Large, clean rooms with rather large bathroom. A/C worked well and there was a little fridge, which was very useful. The bed felt bigger than typical European beds. The major problems were the noise on the street and the long walk from the main tourist sites. This is a great value if you don't mind the walk.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Select from 5 - 9 June 2006

reviews.title: Funky smell
reviews.text: We took a taxi to the Select from the station for under € 8 and it took less than 10 minutes. Although the hotel was a little further than we would have liked it to be from the town centre, it turned out not to be as big a deal as we originally thought it would be. A number 22 bus has a stop not far from the hotel and the service is frequent and cost € 1 and tickets are available form the hotel reception. Although the staff didn’t go out of their way to make conversation, they were polite and helpful when asked for assistance.

As usual you are a little apprehensive when you are about to open the door of the room you will call home for the next number of days and wonder if its up to your expectations, having been caught out before, the concern is always there.
reviews.title: Nice rooms!
Nice room
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was reasonably decorated and although we couldn’t initially put our finger on what we didn’t like about the bedroom, I think it was the darker base colour on the walls, dark carpet and the dark furniture to match an old window frame. There is a children’s playschool at the rear of the room we were in (118) and although as you would expect they were noisy, it didn’t bother us, as we weren’t there during the day. The bathroom was well appointed, as was the decor in the parts of the hotel we saw. However, breakfast was poor and basically bread and cheese and ham. My biggest disappointment was the fact that there was no bar that you could sit and unwind in after you had tramped the streets all day long, which was doubly disappointing as I had read a list of facilities prior to booking that said there was a bar. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels changed. The fridge in our room was never working during our stay although reported as such and the extra pillows we asked for never appeared. We would have preferred a hotel closer to the centre and also better appointed and certainly one with a bar where you could sit and relax with that last drink before retiring for the evening. For these reasons, we would not re-book in future.
